HowTo.title: How to Use the Mat Calculator
HowTo.heroDescription: A step-by-step guide to calculating perfect mat dimensions for your photo framing projects.
HowTo.step1Description: Measure the interior dimensions of your frame in millimeters. This is the opening inside the frame where the mat will sit — not the outside frame dimensions.
HowTo.step2Description: Measure the photo or artwork you want to frame. Enter the width and height in millimeters. Make sure to measure the visible area you want displayed.
HowTo.step3Description: Select a cutting style that suits your aesthetic. For traditional art, try Talon style which adds more weight at the bottom — a classic fine art framing technique.
HowTo.step4Description: The calculator shows the exact mat margins for each side (top, right, bottom, left) in millimeters. Use these measurements when cutting your mat board.
HowTo.proportionalDesc: Equal margins on all sides. The simplest and most modern approach, ideal for contemporary photography.
HowTo.uniformDesc: Averaged distribution that creates even visual weight. Great for standard photo sizes.
HowTo.talonDesc: Larger bottom margin following the fine arts tradition. This creates visual stability and is the preferred style for gallery-quality framing.
HowTo.panoramicDesc: Reduced horizontal margins to emphasize wide-format images. Perfect for landscape photography.
HowTo.portraitDesc: Reduced vertical margins to emphasize tall images. Ideal for vertical portraits and architectural shots.
HowTo.tip1: Always add 2-3mm to your photo dimensions for mounting tolerance.
HowTo.tip2: For acid-free preservation, use museum-quality mat board.
HowTo.tip3: Use a sharp blade and metal ruler for clean cuts.
HowTo.tip4: Practice cuts on scrap mat board before cutting your final piece.
